Protesters (Somalia)||Residents of Saylac (Isse Clan) demonstrate in front of the offices of Seylac Municipal Council in the morning of 08/01. The demonstrators were opposed to the nomination of new mayors and their deputies in Saylac and Lughaye alleging that the new officer bearers do not hail from these two towns. The protestors also expressed their support to the statement made by Isse traditional leaders in Diri Dawa (Ethiopia) and Ceel Gaal (Somaliland) that they do not recognize the new mayors for Saylac and Lughaye districts. |NGO Safety Program

Protesters (Somalia)|Police Forces of Somaliland (1991-)|Hundreds of people staged a demonstration in Saylac (Zeila) and surrounded the local government office on 09/01. The demonstrators were protesting against the council election and the planned nomination of the new mayor. Police fired in the air to disperse the protestors, resulting in one of the demonstrators being shot and killed. Following the shooting the Djibouti government closed it's border with the Somaliland. |NGO Safety Program

Isse Mohamed Sub-Clan Militia (Somalia)|Civilians (Somalia)|Unidentified person of the Isse clan burnt the car of the mayor of Seylac, who is of the Samaron clan, using a petrol bomb in the morning of 10/01.|NGO Safety Program
